data.title: Boy Names: Top 1,000 in the U.S. (2024)
data.meta_description: There are many choices when it comes to naming your baby boy. Here is what the current U.S. birth certificate data revealed for the top 1,000 boy names.
data.text:
Finding the perfect name for your baby boy can take some time and consideration, but it can also be a lot of fun. Are you looking for a boy name that honors a cultural tradition? Or do you want your child to have a completely unique boy name? Whatever your approach, you'll find plenty of options in this list of the 1,000 most popular baby boy names, as recorded by the Social Security Administration (SSA).

A quick scroll reveals that several names have reigned supreme for years, like Oliver, Elijah, Noah, and James—just to name a few. You'll also find some pop culture nods, along with classics. Take a look to help you narrow down your favorites (or inspire new ones), and enjoy the experience of finding a boy name that you love for your new baby.

Top 10 Baby Boy Names of 2024

Liam

This Irish name means "strong-willed warrior" or protector, and has held the number one rank of boy names since 2017.

Noah

With Hebrew origins, the name Noah means "rest." There are also some gender-neutral variations of this classically popular name, such as Noa.

Oliver

Oliver means "olive tree" or "elf army" and has Latin roots. It entered the top 1,000 boy names in 2009 and has been steadily climbing ever since!

James

The name James is an iconic one, with a number of variations including Jamie or Jaime. It has Hebrew and Greek origins, and has been a top 10 name for nearly every decade in the past century.

Elijah

Another classically biblical name, Elijah has Hebrew roots and translates to "Jehova is my God." The name's popularity has been growing lately, first entering the top 10 in 2016.

Mateo

Mateo has a multitude of origins, including Spanish, Italian, and French, and means "Gift of God." The moniker has been gaining traction over the years, but didn't enter the top 10 until 2022.

Theodore

This Greek name, meaning "Gift of God" or "divine gift," has held popularity for quite some time. Theodore is also an old name, having been around since ancient Greece, and can be shortened to the effortlessly cool nickname Theo.

Henry

Meaning "house ruler," the name Henry has been popular for decades. It has French and German origins, and calls to mind several famous Henrys including Henry Hudson, Henry Ford, and Henry Cavill.

Lucas

The name Lucas has both Greek and Latin roots and translates to "light" or "bringer of light." It entered the top 10 names in 2018 and has held position since then.

William

Another classic name! William means "resolute protector" or "strong-willed warrior," and has English origins. It's been a classic choice around the world for centuries.

Special Considerations

Middle Names

In the United States, it's traditional for a person to have three names—a first name, a middle name, and your family or last name. Of course, there are plenty of parents who give their children more than one middle name, or none at all.

Whatever you choose for your child, it's always a good idea to make sure the names flow well together as a group, and that the initials don't spell out something that might embarrass you or them in the future! It may sound like common sense, but making sure you run through these considerations with your favorite names will help you feel more confident in finding the perfect name for your little one.

Family Names

Choosing a family name for your baby is still a common tradition, but there are multiple ways to go about it. In some families, the child (usually the firstborn) has the exact same name as the father, with the addition of a "Jr." (meaning junior) suffix at the end. If this extends beyond the original father and son, you typically use Roman numerals (II, III, IV, V, etc.) to depict this designation.

In other families, name-sharing may be less traditional. Some parents will name their child the same first name as the father, but call them by their more unique middle name to help differentiate between the two. Or some families use different names completely, but choose ones that have similar meanings or sounds to honor the original name.

When it comes to sharing names, be sure to consider the most famous and historical figures who will share your son's name. Are they individuals you want your son to be associated with? Whether you plan for it or not, the association with a famous person who shares the same name will likely follow your child throughout their lives so take special care to make sure you're happy with the choice.

Gender-Neutral Names

There are so many great gender-neutral names you might not have thought of yet in your search. Take a look—you might just find the one you've been waiting for!

About This List

The Social Security Administration (SSA) usually releases birth certificate data around Mother's Day each year. It compiles the most popular baby names from the previous year. Listed above are the top 1,000 baby boy names from 2023, as determined by birth certificate data.

In addition to this list, you can search the entire SSA database for over 100 years' worth of baby name data, from 1879 forward, on your search for the best name for your little one.

More Baby Name Ideas
